org.apache.spark.graphx.impl

Class VertexPartitionBaseOps<VD,Self extends VertexPartitionBase<Object>>

  • Object
    • org.apache.spark.graphx.impl.VertexPartitionBaseOps<VD,Self>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Logging
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ShippableVertexPartitionOps, VertexPartitionOps

    public abstract class VertexPartitionBaseOps<VD,Self extends VertexPartitionBase<Object>>
extends Object
implements scala.Serializable, Logging
    An class containing additional operations for subclasses of VertexPartitionBase that provide implicit evidence of membership in the VertexPartitionBaseOpsConstructor typeclass (for example, VertexPartition.VertexPartitionOpsConstructor).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • map

        public <VD2> Self map(scala.Function2<Object,VD,VD2> f,
             scala.reflect.ClassTag<VD2> evidence$4)
        Pass each vertex attribute along with the vertex id through a map function and retain the original RDD's partitioning and index.

        Parameters:
        f - the function applied to each vertex id and vertex attribute in the RDD

        Returns:
        a new VertexPartition with values obtained by applying f to each of the entries in the original VertexRDD. The resulting VertexPartition retains the same index.

      • filter

        public Self filter(scala.Function2<Object,VD,Object> pred)
        Restrict the vertex set to the set of vertices satisfying the given predicate.

        Parameters:
        pred - the user defined predicate

      • minus

        public Self minus(Self other)
        Hides the VertexId's that are the same between `this` and `other`.

      • minus

        public Self minus(scala.collection.Iterator<scala.Tuple2<Object,VD>> other)
        Hides the VertexId's that are the same between `this` and `other`.

      • diff

        public Self diff(Self other)
        Hides vertices that are the same between this and other. For vertices that are different, keeps the values from other. The indices of this and other must be the same.

      • innerJoinKeepLeft

        public Self innerJoinKeepLeft(scala.collection.Iterator<scala.Product2<Object,VD>> iter)
        Similar to innerJoin, but vertices from the left side that don't appear in iter will remain in the partition, hidden by the bitmask.
